header.title: Godzilla Meets E.T.: The Calls and Medieval Cosmology & The Nature and Attributes of the Tablets

central_thesis: The Enochian magickal system is an artificial, divinely engineered artifact designed as an educational tool for the magician's evolution, structured around a concentric cosmology that maps to the Earth's physical and spiritual layers. While Dee's records and later Golden Dawn interpretations contain ambiguities and hierarchical inversions, the author proposes a refined system, especially for attribute assignment and invocation, that better aligns with the system's internal logic and practical efficacy for advanced magical work.

structure_content.chapter_title: Godzilla Meets E.T., Part 1: The Calls and Medieval Cosmology
structure_content.summary: This section introduces the Enochian magickal system as a unique 'artifact' of divine engineering, intended for the magician's evolution into godhood. It outlines the basic components: the Tablet of God, 48 Calls, the Great Table, and Liber Scientiae. The First Call is presented as a symbolic recapitulation of creation, detailing a seven-phrase 'downward current' (macrocosm to microcosm) and a five-phrase 'return current' (response, microcosm to macrocosm), also serving as a general ritual formula. The Second Call defines the system's structural framework. The 16 Elemental Calls invoke elements and Lesser Angles. The text establishes a concentric cosmological model for the Calls, correlating their sequence to spheres around the Earth, from outermost (Third Call) to innermost (Eighteenth Call), and linking elemental sequencing (Fire lowest to Air highest) to the Earth's physical layers. It suggests a 'local creator' concept for the Enochian God within a larger universe.

structure_content.chapter_title: Chapter 2: The Nature and Attributes of the Tablets
structure_content.summary: This chapter delves into the structure and use of the Enochian Tablets, highlighting ambiguities in their attributes, particularly between Dee's original system and the Golden Dawn's revisions. The author critiques the Golden Dawn's attribute assignments for the Great Cross and Lesser Angles, arguing they are often superficial or hierarchically inverted. A new system is proposed where square attributes depend on their role in specific divine names, allowing for multiple attributes per square. Detailed methods for forming names (God-names, Elemental Kings, Seniors, Kerubic, Servient Angels) from the Great Cross and Lesser Angle Crosses are provided, along with recommended invocation hierarchies. The chapter also introduces the 'Pyramid Visualization' technique for astral exploration and interaction with angelic entities, complete with attribute color tables for practical application.

key_concepts.definition: A unique, divinely engineered 'artifact' that uses natural forces in deliberately arranged ways, functioning as an educational tool for magicians to evolve into gods. It is described as a 'Swiss Army Knife of magick' due to its versatile applications but also has a 'Trojan Horse' aspect, committing the magician to evolutionary work.

Forty-eight invocations in an 'angelic' language. The First Call outlines the creative process and serves as a general ritual formula. The Second Call defines the structural framework of the system. Calls 3-18 are Elemental Calls, invoking specific elements and Lesser Angles, and follow a concentric cosmological sequence around Earth.

The central material talisman of the Enochian system, comprised of Elemental Tablets and a binding cross (Tablet of Union). It embodies the order and structure of the spiritual energies and divine will.

A medieval model where the Earth is at the center, surrounded by concentric spheres of planets, zodiac, and fixed stars. Rowe adapts this to the Enochian system, viewing it as layers of the planet Earth's 'magickal being' rather than the entire universe, with Calls and Aethyrs mapping to these layers.

Three, four, or five-letter names read from the 'Line of the Holy Spirit' of a Tablet's Great Cross. They invoke the creator's power, filtering it to be compatible with the Tablet's element, and relate to the zodiac.

Formed by a spiral around the center of a Tablet's Great Cross. Its function is to concentrate the filtered power from the Names of God and transfer it downwards through all planes. Analogous to Kether and the Yod of IHVH, representing archetypal, concentrating force.

Six or seven-letter names read outwards from the center of a Tablet's Great Cross. They govern 'knowledge and judgment in human affairs,' correspond to planetary forces, diffuse the King's power, and act as buffers and conduits for energy, representing a Briatic nature.

Sub-sections of the Elemental Tablets, each attributed to a sub-element. They contain their own hierarchies of God-names (6 & 5 letters for calling and commanding sub-elemental powers), Kerubic Angels, and Servient Angels.

Four angels in each Lesser Angle, expressing purity and fixity. They have a larger range of action, bypassing solar influence and dealing directly with God. Their god-name, formed by adding a letter from the Tablet of Union, represents the 'transubstantiation of elements into a divine substance' (IHShVH).

Angels associated with each line below the horizontal bar of the Lesser Angle Cross. They govern elements in the natural world, representing mutable forces, and act as trainers for elemental beings, teaching responsiveness. Each letter has dual elemental attributes (INRI and YHShVh).

A practical technique for astral vision and interaction with Enochian entities. It involves visualizing a hollow truncated pyramid, inscribing letters and symbols, vibrating Calls/names, and entering the pyramid in the astral body to evoke visions or interact with angels associated with specific squares.

practical_system.description: The system outlines specific methods for invoking various tiers of Enochian entities using the 48 Calls in conjunction with names derived from the Great Table and Lesser Angles. It emphasizes the magician's intent and proposes a flexible hierarchy for invocation, allowing 'names of power' to produce entities. A core operative technique is 'Pyramid Visualization' for astral exploration, where a magician constructs a hollow truncated pyramid in imagination, inscribes letters and symbols, vibrates Calls/names, and then astrally enters the pyramid to evoke and interact with specific angels, gaining knowledge of the square's nature.
tools: The Tablet of God (or Tablet of Nalvage, possibly a lamen)
The Great Table (including Elemental Tablets and Tablet of Union)
Knowledge of name formation rules from the Great Cross and Lesser Angle Crosses
Color attributes (for elements, planets, zodiac signs) for pyramid visualization
Standard glyphs of planets and Hebrew letters for pyramid symbolism
rituals: Invocation of Tablet of Union names (First Call + Call of Name's element + Vibration)
Invocation of Three Names of God (First Call + Call of the Tablet + Vibration)
Invocation of Elemental King (First Call + Call of the Tablet + Vibration of Three Names of God and Elemental King)
Invocation of Seniors (Call of the Tablet + Vibration of Three Names of God, Elemental King, and Senior's name)
Invocation of Lesser Angle God-Names (Optional Call of the Tablet + Optional Vibration of higher names + Call of the Lesser Angle + Vibration of God-Name)
Invocation of Kerubic Angels (as for Kerubic God-name, adding Kerubic Angel's name after God-name)
Invocation of Servient Angels (Optional Call of the Tablet + Optional Vibration of higher names + Call of the Lesser Angle + Vibration of Servient Angel)
Pyramid Visualization for astral work and interaction with entities associated with individual Enochian squares.

relevant_quotes.text: What most distinguishes the Enochian magickal system is that it is an artifact, a made thing. Other systems attempt to describe the universe (or some part of it) as it is, providing a framework which corresponds to observable natural structures and events, attempting to work with forces in their natural states. This is not true of the Enochian; like a product of human engineering it uses natural forces, but arranges and concentrates them in ways that could never be produced through normal evolutionary processes. Every aspect of its structure evinces the presence of deliberate creative intent behind its existence.
It lures the magician with the promise of power and glory; after he has been drawn in, he finds he has irrevocably committed himself to the work of evolution.
The Call follows the path of creation from the macrocosm to the microcosm, then follows the return current in the form of a response from the microcosm directed at the macrocosm.

In the Enochian magick, the Great Table is the talisman to which all the energies have been attached, and every copy of the Table (or any part of it) also possesses the same connections through the Laws of Correspondences or Similarity.
As a general rule, the Second Call should never be used in the same session as the First Call.

Additionally, the sequencing of the four elements in the Enochian scheme -- Fire lowest, then Earth, Water, and Air -- has a direct relation to the spherical layering found in the physical body of the Earth.
The Calls, Tablets, and Aethyrs are simply three different 'maps' superimposed on a single underlying sphere of existence.

If there is a god who gives its attention to this world, as does the god of the Enochian system, it must be relatively local in scope and influence. This raises the possibility -- rather, the inevitability -that within the universe there are other places where other gods work out schemes of creation different from our own.
Since every modern usage of the Tablets stems from the Golden Dawn practice, it is possible that for over a century magicians have been using the Tablets incorrectly.
Experiment can not help to determine a 'true' or 'correct' manner of usage. Enochian is a genuine magickal language; every letter not only signifies but invokes a force.

The key to finding an alternate system is to understand the primary blind spot of the G.D. magicians. They took the diagrammatic form of the Tablets as being of primary importance. That is, each square in each Tablet was a single power, and could only have a single attribute, which was determined by the visually distinct region of the Tablet in which the square was located.

So the Golden Dawn system of attributes involves an inversion of hierarchy among the powers it includes; the lowest powers are given the highest place, while the highest are put into minor places in the Tablets. Such an inversion should tell us that something is wrong with the system...

critical_analysis.relevance: Benjamin Rowe's work offers a critical re-evaluation of the Enochian system, moving beyond rigid interpretations from the Golden Dawn tradition. It's highly relevant for practitioners seeking a deeper, more internally consistent understanding of Enochian magic, providing a framework that reconciles historical accounts with practical experience and modern cosmological insights. His emphasis on the system as an 'artifact' and an 'educational tool' rather than just a descriptive model, along with the 'local creator' concept, offers fresh perspectives on the nature of divine interaction in magic.
critical_analysis.target_audience: Advanced practitioners of Western Esotericism, Occultism, and Enochian Magic, particularly those familiar with John Dee's works and the Golden Dawn tradition. It caters to magicians who are engaged in active experimentation, astral work, and who seek a nuanced, internally coherent system for invoking and interacting with Enochian entities, rather than a dogmatic adherence to established but potentially flawed traditions.
